result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:59 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Donald Lee Morris. Defendant Donald Lee Morris appeared by video. Court reviews case. Atty Bjork states there is not a resolution and request to set for Trial. Court sets JT and FPT. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 12:01 PM
Jury trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:15 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.P.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:00 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Donald Lee Morris in court.  Attorney John P Bjork in court for Donald Lee Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared by Zoom. Karn of VW appeared. Court reviews file. VW states victim is requesting to remove no contact. Victim makes statements. Waive reading. Waive speedy trial. Court sets STC via Zoom to allow Atty Bjork time to receive and review discovery for potential motions. Adjourned at 2:10 PM.  gll
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.P. EXCEPT through a third-party regarding child exchange.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:05 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Aaron Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Donald Lee Morris in court. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD-PFAC given. Bond argument; bond ordered. Bond previously posted to be returned to payor. NG.  Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court sets BBH to revisit no contact provision of bond. Adjourned at 2:12 PM.  gll
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
